svg.text: Week in Ethereum News - May 13 2023

title: "Week in Ethereum News
May 13, 2023" date: "2023-05-13"
Eth News and Links
Brief loss of finalization and first inactivity leak
• Beacon chain stopped finalizing twice over the past 36 hours and had first inactivity leak Consensus
clients on lower spec hardware struggled to follow the chain after valid but untimely attestations
were broadcast Bottom line: blocks & transactions continued For a short time, Ethereum devolved into
the same probabilistic finality as PoW Consensus client teams are working on patches Lighthouse
overtook Prysm as majority consensus client , reminder: no client should have more than a 33% share,
switch to a minority client
• Consensus clients on lower spec hardware struggled to follow the chain after valid but untimely
attestations were broadcast
Consensus clients on lower spec hardware struggled to follow the chain after valid but untimely
• Bottom line: blocks & transactions continued
Bottom line: blocks & transactions continued
• For a short time, Ethereum devolved into the same probabilistic finality as PoW
For a short time, Ethereum devolved into the same probabilistic finality as PoW
• Consensus client teams are working on patches
Consensus client teams are working on patches
• Lighthouse overtook Prysm as majority consensus client , reminder: no client should have more than a
33% share, switch to a minority client
Lighthouse overtook Prysm as majority consensus client , reminder: no client should have more than a
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
• Latest all core devs – execution (ACDE) call video . Summary by Tim Beiko. Notes from Tim Beiko and
Christine Kim : EIP4844: agreed to use big-endian for EL inputs/outputs and use RLP on EL & SSZ on CL
via Engine API and discussion on state of KZG libraries Meta discussion if Layer 2 focused EIPs need
to go through core devs e.g. EIP6968 Cancun upgrade EIP candidates for inclusion to be discussed on
next ACDE
Latest all core devs – execution (ACDE) call video . Summary by Tim Beiko. Notes from Tim Beiko and
Christine Kim :
• EIP4844: agreed to use big-endian for EL inputs/outputs and use RLP on EL & SSZ on CL via Engine API
and discussion on state of KZG libraries
EIP4844: agreed to use big-endian for EL inputs/outputs and use RLP on EL & SSZ on CL via Engine API
• Meta discussion if Layer 2 focused EIPs need to go through core devs e.g. EIP6968
Meta discussion if Layer 2 focused EIPs need to go through core devs e.g. EIP6968
• Cancun upgrade EIP candidates for inclusion to be discussed on next ACDE
Cancun upgrade EIP candidates for inclusion to be discussed on next ACDE
• KZG ceremony available to anyone with 32 mainnet transactions . Wait time is generally zero.
KZG ceremony available to anyone with 32 mainnet transactions . Wait time is generally zero.
Layer 1
• MEV unbundling attack variant disclosed with temporary mitigation
MEV unbundling attack variant disclosed with temporary mitigation
• Evmone v0.10.0 : Shanghai upgrade & EOF v1 support and performance improvements
Evmone v0.10.0 : Shanghai upgrade & EOF v1 support and performance improvements
• List of projects from the third Ethereum Protocol Fellowship cohort
List of projects from the third Ethereum Protocol Fellowship cohort
Client releases
• Consensus layer: Nimbus v23.5.0 : fixes missed block proposals when using an external builder in
v23.4, experimental Web3Signer extension to verify block properties
• Nimbus v23.5.0 : fixes missed block proposals when using an external builder in v23.4, experimental
Web3Signer extension to verify block properties
Research
• Proposal to consolidate large stakes into fewer validators to reduce p2p messages
Proposal to consolidate large stakes into fewer validators to reduce p2p messages
• zkCasper : verify Casper FFG consensus proofs using SNARKs, increases security of light clients
zkCasper : verify Casper FFG consensus proofs using SNARKs, increases security of light clients
• ArbiNet : MEV transaction detection using Graph Neural Networks
ArbiNet : MEV transaction detection using Graph Neural Networks
Layer 2
• Optimism transaction delays postmortem
EIPs/Standards
• EIPs: EIP6992 : HTTP requests EIP7002 : Execution layer triggerable exits
EIPs:
• EIP6992 : HTTP requests
EIP6992 : HTTP requests
• EIP7002 : Execution layer triggerable exits
EIP7002 : Execution layer triggerable exits
• ERCs: ERC6997 : ERC721 with transaction validation step ERC7007 : zkML AIGC-NFTs ERC7015 : NFT
authorship attribution ERC7017 : Notification interface ERC7023 : Automatic transaction representation
ERCs:
• ERC6997 : ERC721 with transaction validation step
ERC6997 : ERC721 with transaction validation step
• ERC7007 : zkML AIGC-NFTs
ERC7007 : zkML AIGC-NFTs
• ERC7015 : NFT authorship attribution
ERC7015 : NFT authorship attribution
• ERC7017 : Notification interface
ERC7017 : Notification interface
• ERC7023 : Automatic transaction representation
ERC7023 : Automatic transaction representation
Stuff for developers
• Solidity v0.8.20 : adds Shanghai support & sets Shanghai as default EVM version, experimental AST
import via Standard JSON Change EVM version when deploying Solidity v0.8.20+ to Layer 2 or other
networks if they don’t support Shanghai
Solidity v0.8.20 : adds Shanghai support & sets Shanghai as default EVM version, experimental AST
import via Standard JSON
• Change EVM version when deploying Solidity v0.8.20+ to Layer 2 or other networks if they don’t
support Shanghai
• Nomic Foundation Slang (Solidity compiler) alpha release, testers wanted
Nomic Foundation Slang (Solidity compiler) alpha release, testers wanted
• Foundry: Pre v1.0 changes Etch cheat to debug deployed contract, add console.log & replace the code
in a fork Vulcan v0.1 : dev framework for Foundry projects, aims for improved vm naming & test
readability
Foundry:
• Pre v1.0 changes
Pre v1.0 changes
• Etch cheat to debug deployed contract, add console.log & replace the code in a fork
Etch cheat to debug deployed contract, add console.log & replace the code in a fork
• Vulcan v0.1 : dev framework for Foundry projects, aims for improved vm naming & test readability
Vulcan v0.1 : dev framework for Foundry projects, aims for improved vm naming & test readability
• pureConsole : Solidity library for console logging from pure functions
pureConsole : Solidity library for console logging from pure functions
• Protomerkle : Solidity library to build onchain merkle trees
Protomerkle : Solidity library to build onchain merkle trees
• YulExp2Huff : convert Yul arithmetic expressions to Huff equivalent
YulExp2Huff : convert Yul arithmetic expressions to Huff equivalent
• Wagmi v1 : uses viem (rather than ethers), reduced bundle size, prepare hooks not mandatory and
deterministic errors;
Wagmi v1 : uses viem (rather than ethers), reduced bundle size, prepare hooks not mandatory and
• RainbowKit v1 : supports wagmi v1 & viem, improved browser extension support
RainbowKit v1 : supports wagmi v1 & viem, improved browser extension support
• OpenZeppelin Contracts Wizard + Remix used to deploy a testnet memecoin in 27 seconds
OpenZeppelin Contracts Wizard + Remix used to deploy a testnet memecoin in 27 seconds
• Coherent mainnet dataset : CC0, 95% decoded logs/txs/traces, via Snowflake or API
Coherent mainnet dataset : CC0, 95% decoded logs/txs/traces, via Snowflake or API
• PGP onchain keyserver , concept
PGP onchain keyserver , concept
• Dappnet : portal for decentralized front ends, Chrome/Firefox/Brave on macOS, alpha
Dappnet : portal for decentralized front ends, Chrome/Firefox/Brave on macOS, alpha
Security
• Immunefi: unauthorized whitehat hacking is unethical
Ecosystem
• Validator exit queue was emptied of everyone wanting to withdraw
Validator exit queue was emptied of everyone wanting to withdraw
• Ether supply is down 100k ETH in 30 days
Ether supply is down 100k ETH in 30 days
• Google search for an address shows Ether balance, doesn’t support ENS yet
Google search for an address shows Ether balance, doesn’t support ENS yet
Enterprise
• EY OpsChain ESG : tokenized CO2 emissions & carbon credits, beta
Notable at app layer
• Rune’s Maker endgame roadmap : rebranding, new stablecoin & governance token (1:1200 ratio)
Rune’s Maker endgame roadmap : rebranding, new stablecoin & governance token (1:1200 ratio)
• Maker Spark Protocol : lend & borrow ETH, stETH, DAI & sDAI
Maker Spark Protocol : lend & borrow ETH, stETH, DAI & sDAI
• Aragon Association refusing to transfer treasury to Aragon DAO
Aragon Association refusing to transfer treasury to Aragon DAO
• Cozy v2 (protection marketplace) live on Optimism, non-US, limited to $5M per protection set
Cozy v2 (protection marketplace) live on Optimism, non-US, limited to $5M per protection set
• Ethereum Attestation Service : attest & verify a file
Ethereum Attestation Service : attest & verify a file
• Tessera (formerly Fractional) winding down
Tessera (formerly Fractional) winding down
• Karma delegate activity tracker to check DAO delegate performance
Karma delegate activity tracker to check DAO delegate performance
Job Listings
• Snr React Native UI Dev at Status: All jobs
Snr React Native UI Dev at Status: All jobs
• Solidity team need a highly skilled Developer Advocate
Solidity team need a highly skilled Developer Advocate
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit), payable to abcoathup.eth. Questions?
abcoathup at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
• US Chamber of Commerce amicus brief in Coinbase SEC case
US Chamber of Commerce amicus brief in Coinbase SEC case
• Biden gaslights that there is a special tax loophole for crypto
Biden gaslights that there is a special tax loophole for crypto
• Former Coinbase product manager sentenced to 2 years jail in insider trading case
Former Coinbase product manager sentenced to 2 years jail in insider trading case
• IRS $44 billion claims on FTX entities
IRS $44 billion claims on FTX entities
General/crypto
• Pseudorandom functions & permutations explainer
Pseudorandom functions & permutations explainer
• MSI private keys published by hackers , could be used to to sign malware
MSI private keys published by hackers , could be used to to sign malware
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup and
@evan_van_ness to get most of the week’s news in real time.
